subject: Re: [junit] idiom for overriding tearDown()
msgSnippet: ... Interesting. If you use JUnit-addons test runner, then (b) is a little redundant. To be frank, I ve never even considered it, because when tearDown() fails
messageBody:
Paul Holser wrote:
> generally speaking, which is preferred:
>
> a)
> protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
> // tear down your fixture here...
>
> super.tearDown();
> }
>
> or
>
> b)
> protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
> try {
> // tear down your fixture here...
> }
> finally {
> super.tearDown();
> }
> }

Interesting. If you use JUnit-addons test runner, then (b) is a little
redundant.

To be frank, I've never even considered it, because when tearDown()
fails for me -- which is quite rare -- it's not a recoverable problem.

I suppose there's no good general answer here. You would do (b) only if
you knew (a) to be insufficient.
